definition: to make an effort/to push for sth/to work hard
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to exert oneself (bound form)
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to prove one's worth through firm resolve (idiom)

sentences.english: You think it was the resolution of Goujian, the Yue king?
sentences.chinese: 你认为是越王勾践卧薪尝胆发奋励志？

sentences.english: Nation-building needs talent, worked hard and is ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 国家建设需人才，发奋图强宏图现。

sentences.english: Less swim unwilling humiliation was younger sister, have vowed to take on their own hard.
sentences.chinese: 少游不甘被小妹屈辱，誓言会靠自己发奋。

sentences.english: He tries to get the iphone well over the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 他发奋去够架子上的苹果，但是没能够到。

sentences.english: Achievers are good at motivating others.
sentences.chinese: 善于激励别人发奋图强。

sentences.english: Life is a great big canvas, and you should throw all the paint on it you can.
sentences.chinese: 人生是一幅大画布，你就应发奋绘出绚丽多彩的画面。

sentences.english: In the world, a man who would make his way, must plague and bestir himself night and day.
sentences.chinese: 要在人世间成功进取，须日日夜夜发奋磨练。

sentences.english: Hard work is often a ladder to success.
sentences.chinese: 发奋工作常是通向成功的阶梯。

sentences.english: We promised to meet in the United States. So we both worked hard at our lessons.
sentences.chinese: 我们曾相约在美国相见，因此我们都在发奋读书。

sentences.english: Always work hard on something uncomfortably exciting!
sentences.chinese: 那就是在那些让人极度兴奋的事情上发奋努力。

definition: to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
to make a determined effort
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
to study hard/assiduous
diligent/industrious (in one's studies)/to study hard/to make great effort
assiduous/taking great pains
to be determined/to be resolved
to study assiduously and tirelessly (idiom)/see also 頭懸梁，錐刺股|头悬梁，锥刺股[tou2 xuan2 liang2 , zhui1 ci4 gu3]
lit. with his head attached to a beam and stabbing his thigh with an awl (idiom)/fig. to study assiduously and tirelessly
pinyin: tou2 xuan2 liang2 , zhui1 ci4 gu3

definition: diligent/assiduous
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
to study diligently/to train assiduously
to encourage oneself
to strive unremittingly/self-improvement
